Draw Arc 1 starting from the point (0, 0.0059) with a midpoint at (0.0017, 0.0017) ending at (0.0059, 0). Ensure the arc is clockwise. 2. Draw Line 1 from (0.0059, 0) to (0.0879, 0). 3. Draw Arc 2 starting from (0.0879, 0) with a midpoint at (0.092, 0.0017) ending at (0.0937, 0.0059). Make sure the arc is clockwise. 4. Draw Line 2 from (0.0937, 0.0059) to (0.0937, 0.0879). 5. Draw Arc 3 starting from (0.0937, 0.0879) with a midpoint at (0.092, 0.092) ending at (0.0879, 0.0937). Make sure the arc is counterclockwise. 6. Draw Line 3 from (0.0879, 0.0937) to (0.0059, 0.0937). 7. Draw Arc 4 starting from (0.0059, 0.0937) with a midpoint at (0.0017, 0.092) ending at (0, 0.0879). Ensure the arc is counterclockwise. 8. Finally, draw Line 4 from (0, 0.0879) to (0, 0.0059). Create two loops in Face 1 by connecting the outermost points of the curves and closing them: 1. Loop 1 will be formed by Arc 1, Line 1, Arc 2, Line 2, Arc 3, Line 3, Arc 4, and Line 4. 2. Loop 2 will be formed by connecting the endpoints of Line 1, Arc 2, Line 2, Arc 3, and Line 3. Extrusion Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.75 units. This instruction effectively creates a 3D model from the 2D sketch. The model's length, width, and height are determined by the outermost points in the X, Y, and Z directions, respectively. In this case, the length and width are both ~0.0937 units, and the height is 0.75 units. Remember to avoid specific terms such as "NewBodyFeatureOperation", and instead use their natural language descriptions in all instructions as stated in the requirements.</description>
